questions.question_text:
A company manufactures, installs, and maintains residential water filtration systems. The company implements Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

Installation technicians call support technicians when they encounter issues during system installations.

You must create step-by-step documentation for the support technicians.

Which two fields must you include? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
n order to create an agent script, which mandatory fields must you populate..
Owner and Language are correct.

https://neilparkhurst.com/2020/05/29/omnichannel-for-customer-service-agent-scripts-macros-and-slugs/

The question is "which two fields must you included?"
When creating an agent script, the form displays the following fields to be filled:
Name (mandatory)
Unique name (mandatory)
Owner (mandatory)
Language (mandatory)
Description (optional).
So correct answers are owner and language.

Selected Answer: AB
It is making sense that we will need agent script to instruct technicians and we need to record description

questions.question_text:
You are customizing an Omnichannel for Customer Service implementation.

You configure the handoff process to Omnichannel for Customer Service from Power Virtual Agents. However, customer conversations are not escalating to human agents.

You need to complete the configuration to resolve the issue.

Which two features should you configure? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
You should create the context variables before creating the routing rule.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/manage-context-variables?tabs=customerserviceadmincenter

"Context variables enrich conversations with pre-conversation data, channel data, and custom context data. These attributes can then be used to define routing rules to route conversations to different queues."

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company is using Omnichannel for Customer Service.

You add a live chat button to your company’s website for existing customers. Requests for chats are handled by the next available representative. The chat must route the customer to the same representative if the customer is inadvertently disconnected.

You need to configure the chat.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

A company is implementing Omnichannel for Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

The company’s requirements are:

• Live chat must be available through Omnichannel for cases only.
• High-priority cases must automatically be sent to the next available agent.
• Lower-priority cases must wait to be picked up by an agent.
• All work must be distributed evenly with no other conditions.

You need to select the setup that meets the requirements.

Which setup should you select?

choices.B: two workstreams and two routing rules per workstream
choices.D: two workstreams and one routing rule per workstream
choices.A: one workstream and one routing rule
choices.C: one workstream and two routing rules

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Incorrect. There are two different work distribution methods. Pick for lower priority, and push for high priority (auto assigned to next available agent).
A workstream can only have 1 work distrubution mode. Therefore you will need 2 workstreams, each with their ouwn routing rule.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/create-workstreams#create-a-workstream

questions.question_text:
A company is developing a Power Virtual Agents chatbot that integrates with Dynamics 365 Omnichannel for Customer Service. The company has offices in Africa and South America.

You need to deploy Power Virtual Agents (PVAs) to all supported countries/regions.

To which three geographies should you deploy the PVAs? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content: Why would you deploy to Europe??

Makes sense. 
This question is strange. The compnay only has 2 offices, why do we need to install in 3 geographies?
There is no region "Africa" for the Power Virtual Agents. So trying to stay as close as possible. Install in Europe.
